From:

> 
Sent:
 Friday, September 15, 2023 10:15 AM
To:
 Larry Baker <
l.baker@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Podcast 
 
Hi Larry,
Riccardo and Nora were very disappointed about what happened yesterday. Of course, they didn't know what the "urgent" matter was or why we had to cancel the recording.
I apologize on behalf of the team and assured them that we would reschedule, as I was really looking forward to speaking with them. I was wondering if you would be available (and up to!) for that. Dustin mentioned he is willing to help; I had a meeting with him regarding our client, Diligent, and I asked if he could assist. So, my questions for you are:
 
1. Are you available for a rescheduled recording on the 25th, 26th, or 27th?
2. Could you please explain how the podcasts are recorded? Is it as simple as hitting "record" in Teams? This might be a very basic question, but I want to clarify (an educate myself) so I can inform Dustin.
 
Thank you, and I hope you can find some mental rest over the next few days; we all need it.
 
 
Maria Fagrelius
Director of Global Language Solutions
LCW

subject: RE: ACTION: LCW Products + Pricing Changes
body:
Gracias Rebecca, siento lo mismo.
 
Thanks for being a great co worker all these years! It means a lot.
 
Kendall.r.washington@gmail.com
 
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, September 15, 2023 7:26 AM
To:
 Kendall Washington <k.washington@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: ACTION: LCW Products + Pricing Changes
 
Thank you, Kendall.
 
Also, I wanted to tell you how very incredibly sorry I am, this is awful and you don't deserve it. This is not the company I worked for from 2006-early 2022.... I'm so, so, so sorry. Please let me know if I can help in any way in your career post-LCW, including of course being a reference. My personal cell is 773-799-6220 and my personal email is 
rparrilla17@yahoo.com
. 
Sincerely - 
RP
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

 ACTION: LCW Products + Pricing Changes
 
Hi Kendall,
 
Thanks. I reviewed the spreadsheet. A few things:
 
The new pricing also contained changes to 
hourly consulting
. I’ve collapsed rows 10 (hourly consulting) and what used to be row 11 (D&I Strategy hourly) into a single “Consulting (Hourly)”.  New pricing is $250/hr for AC/C and $600 for SC/PC. I changed it on the attached and removed the yellow for this row. 
 
Row 24, ‘project management time’ – I wasn’t aware of this line item previously. Instead of $0 let’s make this one $250/hour to match the AC/C consulting hour fee renamed it to “Project Management (Hourly)”.  
 
Rows 29-57 – Total overhaul here. There is no longer an ‘onsite premium’ – we’re simply charging onsite sessions one way and virtual sessions a different way, based on duration of workshop and # of facilitators, regardless of which session it is – EXCEPT for cultural immersions. I added the items in red on rows 29 and 35. 
 
I deleted all rows that previously contained specific workshop names, including the miniworkshops (again, EXCEPT for the immersions).
 
I also changed the site license prices for our eLearnings from $80k to $60k (green rows 71, 73-75, 77-79, 81). Please do change those too 
unless Dan or Chuck is vehemently opposed
. 
 
When do you think you could get these changed on Compass by, KW?
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

subject: LCW Property Return Instructions
body:
Hello Kendall,
 
 
As stated in the separation agreement, a $75 stipend will be included in your final paycheck to cover the cost of shipping your LCW property to the nearest FedEx facility. If the laptop is not received within three weeks following your last day of employment, LCW will invoice you for the laptop's estimated value.
 
 
Attached you can find your pre-paid FedEx shipping label. 
 
Shipping to: 
 
TeamLogic IT
 
4801 N Lincoln Ave
 
Chicago IL 60625
 
 
If you do not have a box to ship the laptop in, you can purchase one at one of their facilities:
 
 
Please reach out if you have any questions. 
 
 
Briza Cardenas

Hi Kendall,
 
Thanks. I reviewed the spreadsheet. A few things:
 
The new pricing also contained changes to 
hourly consulting
. I’ve collapsed rows 10 (hourly consulting) and what used to be row 11 (D&I Strategy hourly) into a single “Consulting (Hourly)”.  New pricing is $250/hr for AC/C and $600 for SC/PC. I changed it on the attached and removed the yellow for this row. 
 
Row 24, ‘project management time’ – I wasn’t aware of this line item previously. Instead of $0 let’s make this one $250/hour to match the AC/C consulting hour fee renamed it to “Project Management (Hourly)”.  
 
Rows 29-57 – Total overhaul here. There is no longer an ‘onsite premium’ – we’re simply charging onsite sessions one way and virtual sessions a different way, based on duration of workshop and # of facilitators, regardless of which session it is – EXCEPT for cultural immersions. I added the items in red on rows 29 and 35. 
 
I deleted all rows that previously contained specific workshop names, including the miniworkshops (again, EXCEPT for the immersions).
 
I also changed the site license prices for our eLearnings from $80k to $60k (green rows 71, 73-75, 77-79, 81). Please do change those too 
unless Dan or Chuck is vehemently opposed
. 
 
When do you think you could get these changed on Compass by, KW?
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

Bring your boards to life
Say hello to Talktrack
Talktrack lets you bring your Miro boards to life with immersive video walkthroughs. Viewers can interact and contribute to the work as they watch your recording and follow your journey across the board. 
It's like you're in the same room, even when you're not.
See Talktrack in action
 
Uplevel your async game
 
Speak to the work where it is
Record personal walkthroughs over your work in Miro, and invite your collaborators to contribute right on the board.
 
Save meeting time
Be intentional with meetings and how your collaborate with your team. Provide context async, without losing subtext.
 
Bridge the remote gap
Put face, voice and personality into your work, and stay connected with your remote teammates.
 
Where to find Talktrack on Miro?
You can access Talktrack from the record button on the top right hand corner of your Miro board.
See Talktrack in action
 
 
Happy collaborating,
Sophia & the Miro Talktrack Team

subject: BetterHelp through LCW
body:
Hello Kendall,
 
Starting today, you have access to 
(4)
 convenient and professional therapy sessions through BetterHelp online paid completely by LCW. 
We’ve set you up using your personal email, 
kendall.r.washington@gmail.com
. 
You should’ve received an email invitation from 
contact@betterhelp.com
 
contain
ing
 the link to get you started
.
 
 
Below is more information on what BetterHelp is and some FAQs. 
 
Feel free to reach out to me for further information at any time.
 
BetterHelp is the 
leading online therapy platform 
with over 32,000 therapists across the U.S., services in 50+ languages, and support in over 200 countries. You will be able to work with a therapist that is specifically assigned to you based on your individual preferences. You can communicate with your therapist via phone, video and live chat, plus you can message your therapist whenever you’d like. 
 
 
FAQ’s:
 
Will LCW know that I am receiving therapy?
No. Your organization will not know who is receiving therapy. They won't have access to your personal data unless you contact them to let them know or provide authorization for them to get this access.
 
Who are the therapists?
Therapists on BetterHelp are licensed, trained, experienced, and accredited psychologists (PhD / PsyD), marriage and family therapists (LMFT), clinical social workers (LCSW / LMSW), or licensed professional counselors (LPC). All of them have a Masters Degree or a Doctorate Degree in their field. They have been qualified and certified by their state's professional board after successfully completing the necessary education, exams, training and practice. While their experience, expertise and background vary, they all possess at least 3 years and 2,000 hours of hands-on experience. 
 
What type of services does BetterHelp provide?
BetterHelp offers individual, couples and teen therapy services. 
 
Briza Cardenas 
(she/her)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
LCW

subject: Important: We’ll enable security improvements in Microsoft Entra ID beginning September 15, 2023
body:
Let your users know what to expect when they sign in to their work or school account.                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
 
We’re enabling a stronger form of multifactor authentication beginning September 15, 2023
You’re receiving this email because you have a Microsoft Entra ID tenant.
On September 15, 2023, we’ll begin prompting your users who authenticate using SMS and voice methods to set up the Microsoft Authenticator app when they sign in to their work or school account. This change will take place on a rolling basis over six weeks as part of ongoing efforts to improve security.
This change will affect Microsoft Entra ID (previously Azure Active Directory) tenants that have the 
registration campaign
 feature set to the Microsoft managed state. After we enable the feature, users will be prompted to install the 
Microsoft Authenticator
 app, a stronger form of multifactor authentication than 
SMS and voice methods
.
Recommended action
After the registration campaign feature is enabled, everyone in your organization who currently uses SMS or voice authentication will need to set up Microsoft Authenticator. 
To avoid any confusion, let your users know what to expect by September 15, 2023:
When they sign in to their work or school account, they’ll see a 
prompt
 to set up the Authenticator app—they can choose to install it or skip the prompt. They can skip up to three times before they’re required to install it.
To install it, they’ll need to select 
Next
 on the prompt, which will take them through the Authenticator app setup.
Help and support
If you have questions or if you need help, learn more about the 
registration campaign
 feature or see 
support options
.
Account information
Tenant name:
 LCW
Tenant ID:
 3ca40a42-d72d-43c9-b92e-0740101d9dd3
Privacy Statement
 
Microsoft Corporation, 
One Microsoft Way, ​Redmond, WA 98052​

After the registration campaign feature is enabled, everyone in your organization who currently uses SMS or voice authentication will need to set up Microsoft Authenticator. 
To avoid any confusion, let your users know what to expect by September 15, 2023:
When they sign in to their work or school account, they’ll see a 
prompt
 to set up the Authenticator app—they can choose to install it or skip the prompt. They can skip up to three times before they’re required to install it.
To install it, they’ll need to select 
Next
 on the prompt, which will take them through the Authenticator app setup.
Help and support
If you have questions or if you need help, learn more about the 
registration campaign
 feature or see 
support options
.

Subject:
 ACTION: LCW Products + Pricing Changes
 
Hi Kendall,
 
Thanks. I reviewed the spreadsheet. A few things:
 
The new pricing also contained changes to 
hourly consulting
. I’ve collapsed rows 10 (hourly consulting) and what used to be row 11 (D&I Strategy hourly) into a single “Consulting (Hourly)”.  New pricing is $250/hr for AC/C and $600 for SC/PC. I changed it on the attached and removed the yellow for this row. 
 
Row 24, ‘project management time’ – I wasn’t aware of this line item previously. Instead of $0 let’s make this one $250/hour to match the AC/C consulting hour fee renamed it to “Project Management (Hourly)”.  
 
Rows 29-57 – Total overhaul here. There is no longer an ‘onsite premium’ – we’re simply charging onsite sessions one way and virtual sessions a different way, based on duration of workshop and # of facilitators, regardless of which session it is – EXCEPT for cultural immersions. I added the items in red on rows 29 and 35. 
 
I deleted all rows that previously contained specific workshop names, including the miniworkshops (again, EXCEPT for the immersions).
 
I also changed the site license prices for our eLearnings from $80k to $60k (green rows 71, 73-75, 77-79, 81). Please do change those too 
unless Dan or Chuck is vehemently opposed
. 
 
When do you think you could get these changed on Compass by, KW?
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

subject: Action Required: Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy
body:
Dear Valued Customer,
We are reaching out with a reminder that Zoom will be 
enforcing minimum versions as outlined in our 
Software Lifecycle Policy
 on November 4, 2023 (Pacific Standard Time) for all products and services, referenced in the table below. 
This is a quarterly enforcement policy so please check our 
support article
 and 
status page
 for future dates and versions. Users who are running an end-of-life version after November 4, will be logged out of their Zoom Client (Desktop, Mobile, and VDI), or not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client until they update. 
Please note the end-of-life enforcement for Zoom Room Controllers on Windows UWP has been extended to November 4, 2023.
 
This policy will affect the following products on the following dates:
Product
Min version required as of November 4, 2023
 
Zoom Client: Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, Intune, and Blackberry 
5.13.5 (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS, Intune)
5.13.0 (Blackberry)
Zoom Rooms and Zoom Room Controller 
5.13.6 (Windows, macOS, iOS devices and controllers)
5.6.0 (Android controllers)
Zoom Phone Appliances
5.13.6
VDI Client and VDI Plug-in
5.11.2
Virtual Room Connector
5.9.8827.20221230
Meetings Connector
4.8.20230316.163
Recording Connector
5.1.4.169.20230511
Meeting SDK Client 
Windows, macOS, iOS, Android 
5.13.5
Meeting SDK Web
2.9.7
Video SDK Client 
Windows, macOS, iOS, Android 
1.5.3
Video SDK Web
1.5.5
Zoom Contact Center SDK (Native)(Android and iOS)
2.2.0
Zoom Node
1.2.0.2628
Zoom Phone Local Survivability (ZPLS) module
1.12.0.2628
As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom client or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features.
As an admin or owner you can view which versions users on your account are running through the 
Dashboard
 or within the user management portal by filtering by client type. The latest Dashboard update now shows data for every device a user signs in to and summarizes data based on whether the device needs updating to the Zoom minimum supported version. It shows a stacked bar chart of users' different client versions, from oldest to newest. It also shows the percentage of joins on clients requiring updates versus those not requiring updates. 
Thank you for your partnership as we continually work to make our platform more secure and deliver a better experience for our customers. Please feel free to reach out to the 
Zoom Support Team
 if you have any additional questions or need assistance to update your organization.
Team Zoom
 
Catch us on social
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Visit 
zoom.us
1-888-799-9666
55 Almaden Blvd., San Jose, CA 95113
© 2023 Zoom - All Rights Reserved 
You're receiving this email because you signed up for a Zoom account.
If you wish to be removed from our email list, 
unsubscribe
. 
 
.

subject: Request #158426: How would you rate the support you received?
body:
Hello Kendall Washington,
We'd love to hear what you think of our customer service received by Natalie. Please take a moment to answer one simple question below:
How would you rate the support you received?
Good, I'm satisfied
Bad, I'm unsatisfied
Here's a reminder of what this request was about:
 
Natalie
 (Clockify) 
Sep 8, 2023, 18:53 GMT+2 
Hi Kendall,
This is a follow-up to our chat earlier.
Please let me know if your user still has the issues after performing these steps:
1. Log out of Clockify 
2. Clear cache and cookies of their browser (preferably all time date range) 
3. Log back in 
Looking forward to your reply,
Natalie
Support Team | Clockify
 
System
 (Clockify) 
Sep 8, 2023, 17:38 GMT+2 
(17:03:11) *** Kendall joined the chat ***
(17:03:11) Kendall: Hello,
One of our employees is getting an error message when attempting to add time.
TIMEENTRY with id 64fb34391f68886528750749 doesn't belong to WORKSPACE with id 5e9f503fea8094116e9962a6
(17:06:27) Natalie: Hi Kendal! 
My name is Natalie and I will be assisting you today.
(17:08:21) Natalie: Please advise which type of Clockify app they are using to add time: 
- Web-version via browser (via Chrome, Firefox, etc.) 
- Desktop Clockify application (Mac or Windows) 
- Mobile app 
- Extension or some integration?
(17:08:39) Kendall: Web version via browser
(17:09:56) Natalie: Are they adding the entry by starting a timer, or manually?
(17:10:04) Kendall: manually
(17:11:34) Natalie: Thank you, would they be able to: 
1. Log out of Clockify 
2. Clear cache and cookies of their browser (preferably all time date range) 
3. Log back in 
And let us know if the issue persists after that? 
So we can rule out cache overload and investigate further.
(17:13:35) Kendall: Ok, this may take a minute
(17:15:20) Natalie: No problem, I can also make a ticket out of this chat and send you a follow up, so you can get back to me via email if you don't have the time now. 
And we can continue there to see what might be going on the user's side.
(17:18:32) Kendall: Ok we can do that.
(17:19:00) Natalie: No problem, is this the right email to send you a ticket confirmation to: 
k.washington@lcwmail.com
?
(17:19:05) Kendall: Yes
(17:20:01) Natalie: Thank you for the confirmation, unless you have any other questions, I will now close the chat and send you an email follow-up.
(17:20:11) Kendall: Thanks!
(17:38:15) Natalie: Goodbye for now!
(17:38:18) *** Kendall left the chat ***
This email is a service from Clockify. 
[XYXD0J-61XXR]

Excel really is better because it allows us to aggregate and analyze the data. The pdfs by themselves don’t do much for us.
 
If it’s easier for you, you can save multiple trainings on different tabs in the same Excel so that you don’t have hundreds of different files.
 
Thanks,
Dan

Dan

subject: What's New at Zoom | August 2023 Recap
body:
Dear Kendall, 
Whether it's new products and features or courses that teach you to use Zoom better, we are constantly evolving to improve your experience. To help keep you up to date, we have summarized some key new things you should know below. 
Download
 the latest version of the Zoom desktop client to access all these features and more. 
For more resources to help you stay up to date, check out: 
Preview notes
 – A list of upcoming features. This page is only available to Zoom account owners and admins; you must sign in to view them.
Release notes
 – A complete list of past releases across the Zoom platform. 
If you have questions about the features and announcements outlined below, please reply directly to this email.
*Note: Some products and features may not be available to all customers. 
Zoom Learning Center Updates 
Learning in your preferred language has never been easier
 – We’ve revamped the 
Zoom Learning Center catalog
 
with buttons that take you to global language options with a single click. Easily browse and enroll in a variety of courses in English, German, French, Italian, Spanish, Portuguese, Japanese, and Korean. 
Create a seamless hybrid experience with Workspace Reservation
 – Whether you’re a user or admin, learn how to make Workspace Reservation work for you in this 
free course collection
. Check in your guests, book a desk for your day in the office, or reserve the cafe for a company party, all from the convenience of your desktop or tablet.
Harness the power of Zoom Virtual Agent chatbots and campaigns
 – Learn how to customize your Zoom Virtual Agent chatbots and campaigns to create a personalized AI experience your end users will love. Admins, 
enroll free today
!
Events
Zoomtopia 2023 – On October 3-4
, join us at Zoomtopia, our incredible, award-winning event happening in San Jose. Learn to embrace the flexibility and power that AI and the Zoom platform offers. 
Secure your spot
 
to delve into topics like employee health and productivity, return to office and remote work, the balance between human and technology, and more. 
Zoom Events training hub
 
– Visit the Zoom Events training hub to sign up for educational sessions about our Zoom Events product. Training sessions are available every month, including a monthly release discussion and Q&A, where our experts will walk you through the latest Zoom Events release, including key benefits for a variety of use cases like customer training, internal communications, marketing and more. Don’t forget to bookmark the 
Zoom Events Training hub
 
and check back regularly for new training opportunities.   
Key Highlights from Zoom’s August Releases  
Zoom Clips
 Updates 
General public beta availability for Zoom Clips
 – Zoom Clips offer a convenient solution for capturing both personal video and screen activities, allowing users to effortlessly share their recordings with others. This feature is particularly valuable when demonstrating product features or showcasing various functionalities. Users can conveniently access their Clips through their client or web portal, and receive notifications about views, comments, and replies related to their Clips. The feature can be enabled or disabled at the account, group, or user level and is available for public beta during this release. To learn more about Zoom Clips, visit the 
Zoom Clips
 
support page. 
Zoom Client
 Updates 
Meeting Summary: Next Steps and Segment Titles – Windows, macOS – 
The Meeting Summary feature, which uses AI to analyze and summarize in-meeting discussions, is enhanced to also include a list of next steps mentioned in the meeting and titles for each segment of the meeting . These next steps and segment titles are included in the email and Team Chat summary shared with the host and participants (if allowed). 
Zoom Web
 Updates 
Enhanced feedback form: Admin control
 
– The Give Feedback form, available in the desktop client and mobile app, is redesigned to enable customers to provide satisfaction scores and provide feedback on Zoom’s product suite. Admins can choose to provide this feedback option for users on their account, as well as allow users to provide text feedback or just satisfaction scores. This setting is available at the account, group, and user levels.  
Auto-start Meeting Summary with Zoom IQ 
– Admins can allow their users to have the Meeting Summary feature automatically start for any meetings they host, skipping the need for them to manually enable the summary generation during their meetings. Users can still stop and start the summary as needed in the meeting. This is available as a sub-setting to the current Meeting Summary with Zoom IQ setting, available at the account, group, and user-level settings pages. 
Additional captioning language support 
– Automated captioning support is expanding to include captioning for the Farsi/Persian and Romanian languages, both in Beta. These languages are enabled by default, but admins can control the availability of these languages through the Automated captions setting within the web portal. 
Additional translated captioning language support
 – Translated captioning support is expanding to include caption translation from English to Tamil and English to Hebrew, as well as translation support between Portuguese, Romanian Persian, and Canadian French with all other currently supported languages. All of these newly supported languages are currently in Beta. These languages are enabled by default, but admins can control the availability of these languages through the Translated captions setting within the web portal. 
Zoom Scheduler
 Updates 
Allow attendees to add guests to scheduled appointments
 
– Attendees can add guests when they book or reschedule an appointment. A maximum of 100 guests can be added to an appointment. Additionally, guests can reschedule, decline, or delete an appointment. Previously, attendees had to add guests after creating an appointment outside Zoom Scheduler within their calendaring application. 
Zoom IQ for Sales
 Updates 
Multi-Language transcript translation
 
– Users can easily translate conversation transcripts into multiple languages on demand and save these translations for future viewing. This feature currently supports Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Ukrainian, and Vietnamese in addition to English.  
Zoom Phone
 Updates 
Provisioning Template 
– Account owners and administrators can no longer utilize the parameters provisioning/firmware/url and provision.url in the provisioning template. If these parameters are being updated in an existing template or included in a new template, an error will occur, indicating the need for their removal. However, templates created before this change will remain unaffected, and no action is required for them. If configuring these items is critical, 
submit a request
 
to Zoom Support to have this enabled for your account. 
Provisioning walkthrough for Zoom Phone admins
 – Shows admins how to add users to their Zoom account and provision them with the desired Zoom Phone calling plans (extensions) and phone numbers as quickly and efficiently as possible. 
Zoom Events
 Updates 
Upload recording files to Zoom's cloud recording storage for simulive 
– A recording file can be placed into Zoom's cloud recording storage and linked to the hub so that the hub owner or hub hosts can choose it when they are scheduling a simulive webinar. Hosts can set up a simulive webinar and upload their own preferred video. Once the video is processed, it can be selected as the simulive source. Uploaded recordings are also visible in the Zoom web portal recording list and are tagged with the “From a Zoom Events Hub” label. 
Note: This feature must be enabled by Zoom. Zoom Events users who have qualified for video replacement can also upload recordings for Simulive. Zoom Events users who are not on a qualifying account can use Simulive but can only select from existing hub recordings. For additional questions, 
contact Zoom Support
 
to discuss whether this feature is available for your account. 
Security code at event join
 – Hosts can enable the Security code at join option in the event creation setup. A security code will be sent to each attendee's inbox every time they join the host's event. Depending on the attendees' event authentication portfolio, attendees who join an event with the  Security code at join option enabled will have different scenarios. 
Zoom Whiteboard
 Updates 
Allow users who are not signed in to create in-meeting whiteboards 
– Users who are not signed in can initiate and take part in whiteboard sessions during a Zoom meeting, leveraging the "Host owns all boards" feature. This functionality enables unsigned users to view and create a whiteboard, which will be owned by the host since the user is not signed in. To simplify the sign-in process, sign-in options are displayed within both the meeting and whiteboarding interfaces, enabling users to conveniently sign in while actively participating in a meeting or whiteboarding session. 
Zoom Virtual Agent
 Updates 
Amazon Connect integration 
– Account owners and admins can integrate Zoom Virtual Agent with Amazon Connect. This feature can be leveraged to enable the utilization of Amazon Connect as a chat platform when this feature is enabled for the Customer Relationship Management (CRM). With this integration, the knowledge base team can also create a knowledge base sync with Amazon Connect system, mirroring the familiar structure of existing CRM integrations. 
Zoom Contact Center
 Updates
Enhancement to 10DLC registration
 – To comply with carrier regulations and avoid potential message blocking and surcharges, Zoom Contact Center is introducing a warning message for agents who send SMS from US/CA Virtual Service numbers but have not created a 10DLC campaign. This warning will be displayed whenever agents send messages via the Zoom Contact Center client. Messages will not be blocked if a valid 10DLC campaign is active, pending, or associated with the phone number used for messaging. SMS-enabled numbers that are not US/CA numbers are exempt from this requirement.
Business Announcements
Upcoming Support Site Maintenance
 – Maintenance is being performed on Zoom’s support site in November (date and time coming soon). During this time, 
support.zoom.us
 
and the support ticketing form will not be accessible, t hough you can still use Zoom Community, chatbot, and phone support (
based on your plan
) . Please note that once maintenance is performed, tickets closed more than a year ago will no longer be accessible. You can refer to the 
support article
 
and check the 
Zoom status page
 
closer to November for more information. 
Zoom Software Lifecycle Policy 
– We plan to enforce the next round of our Software Lifecycle Policy on 
November 4, 2023
, for all products and services, starting with the minimum versions referenced in the table found 
here
. Users running an end-of-life version after 
November 4
 will not be able to join meetings via the Zoom Client and will be prompted to update or join from the Web browser. As always, we highly recommend you regularly download and update to the latest version of Zoom software by checking for updates within the Zoom desktop client or by navigating to 
zoom.us/download
 to take advantage of all our latest security and functionality features. 
Happy Zooming,
Zoom Success Advisor
You're receiving this email because you are a Zoom customer.
If you wish to be removed from our email list, 
unsubscribe
.

I managed to sort out most of it! However, I do have a lingering concern. The billable work for Translation isn't accurate, as only Diligent is listed. We're missing entries for all the translation clients, such as Alliant and Catalent. Although I recorded all that work under Diligent for my own timekeeping and reference, I believe this needs to be corrected.
Furthermore, I noticed that each Statement of Work (SOW) is properly listed for the consultants, allowing them to track their time effectively for each project. We lack this breakdown for translation. Currently, all billables are lumped under Diligent's general category, with no distinction by translation client or SOW (Scoro Quote number). Please let me know who I should reach out to enter more billable categories for translation. I will be happy to enter them as well each time a project is approved after quoting.

b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, September 6, 2023 10:26 AM
To:
 Daniel Gough <
d.gough@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 SurveyMonkey/MS Forms decision before 9/16
 
Hi Dan,
 
The yearly SurveyMonkey renewal is coming up on September 16
th
. The comparison work to decide whether to keep SurveyMonkey or end our contract with them was assigned to Sarah. With her current circumstance I don’t think she’ll have time to get to this. To help with the final decision, a few of us have met and discussed this topic with a plan on the transition. 
 
Recommendation:
 Cancel the SurveyMonkey subscription, but if we don’t want to end it so soon, we can switch over to month to month for the remainder of the year to fully transition. 
 
Below are the three concerns folks expressed with canceling SurveyMonkey:
Past data & reports - Kendall is downloading all data and saving it in Dropbox
Post facilitation surveys - Consultants have piloted these surveys in MS Forms
NPS survey - MS Forms has the same function as SurveyMonkey 
 
Cost:
$900/year - SurveyMonkey
$25/month for 1 seat - SurveyMonkey
Included in Microsoft - MS Forms
 
SurveyMonkey only allows 3 seats, with Kendall owning verification codes and platform management
MS Forms - Everyone has access to MS Forms and there will be no holdup getting codes or access to the platform
 
Short-Term
Keep SurveyMonkey drop down seats, switch over to month-to month 
(3 months max),
 and only use as a back-up
Upskill the staff on how to use MS Forms
Refine current surveys and finalize questions
Make sure the questions collect data that is easily comparable across all client
 
Long-Term
End month-to-month contract with SurveyMonkey 
(2024)
Fully transition over to Microsoft Forms
Standardize all surveys
 
Briza Cardenas  
(she/her)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
LCW

|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
View our upcoming events
 |

$900/year - SurveyMonkey
$25/month for 1 seat - SurveyMonkey
Included in Microsoft - MS Forms
 
SurveyMonkey only allows 3 seats, with Kendall owning verification codes and platform management
MS Forms - Everyone has access to MS Forms and there will be no holdup getting codes or access to the platform
 
Short-Term
Keep SurveyMonkey drop down seats, switch over to month-to month 
(3 months max),
 and only use as a back-up
Upskill the staff on how to use MS Forms
Refine current surveys and finalize questions
Make sure the questions collect data that is easily comparable across all client
 
Long-Term
End month-to-month contract with SurveyMonkey 
(2024)
Fully transition over to Microsoft Forms
Standardize all surveys
 
Briza Cardenas  
(she/her)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO

System
 (Clockify) 
Sep 8, 2023, 17:38 GMT+2 
(17:03:11) *** Kendall joined the chat ***
(17:03:11) Kendall: Hello,
One of our employees is getting an error message when attempting to add time.
TIMEENTRY with id 64fb34391f68886528750749 doesn't belong to WORKSPACE with id 5e9f503fea8094116e9962a6
(17:06:27) Natalie: Hi Kendal! 
My name is Natalie and I will be assisting you today.
(17:08:21) Natalie: Please advise which type of Clockify app they are using to add time: 
- Web-version via browser (via Chrome, Firefox, etc.) 
- Desktop Clockify application (Mac or Windows) 
- Mobile app 
- Extension or some integration?
(17:08:39) Kendall: Web version via browser
(17:09:56) Natalie: Are they adding the entry by starting a timer, or manually?
(17:10:04) Kendall: manually
(17:11:34) Natalie: Thank you, would they be able to: 
1. Log out of Clockify 
2. Clear cache and cookies of their browser (preferably all time date range) 
3. Log back in 
And let us know if the issue persists after that? 
So we can rule out cache overload and investigate further.
(17:13:35) Kendall: Ok, this may take a minute
(17:15:20) Natalie: No problem, I can also make a ticket out of this chat and send you a follow up, so you can get back to me via email if you don't have the time now.

Subject:
 Sarah update
 
Team – As some of you are now aware, Sarah’s husband, Antoino Nodarse, passed away Saturday morning. We are all heartbroken for her loss. Antonio had demonstrated so much courage for months during his treatment. I do not yet have arrangements to share but wanted to ensure that you had her address in case you wanted to send any personal acknowledgements.
 
1255 S Michigan Ave Apt 2806, Chicago, IL, 60605
 
LCW will, of course, send something on behalf of the company but we know that many of you would want to reach out to Sarah individually. We will share any service arrangements as we have them.
 
Thank you all for unselfishly creating a space for Sarah and her family to focus on providing Antonio with comfort during this difficult time. Being able to focus on her family meant everything to Sarah.
 
Best,
 
Chuck

On Jul 21, 2023 10:28 AM, "Missy Quinn" <
missy@fromdayone.co
> wrote:
Kendall,
 
Excited to share our 2024 calendar of live and virtual people meetings for the HR/DEI and CPO Community.  Please see the press release below but wanted to make sure to bubble this up in your inbox.  Could we set up a call next week to touch base on the calendar and opportunities?
 
How's Monday or Tuesday? Would 3pm either day work for you?
 
Excited to connect and discuss getting Language & Culture Worldwide involved! 
   
 
Best, 
Missy 
Top executives in HR, Diversity, Corporate Culture, Employee Engagement, and Corporate Social Responsibility discuss hybrid work, social impact, employee engagement, and more
 
 
 
FROM DAY ONE 2024 IN-PERSON CONFERENCE SCHEDULE  
 
 
* indicates exact date is confirmed.
*ATLANTA, GA — January 2
*HOUSTON, TX — February 6
*SEATTLE, WA — February 20
*SILICON VALLEY, CA — February 22
SALT LAKE CITY, UT — March 12
*WASHINGTON, D.C. — March 26
BROOKLYN, NY — April 9
BOSTON, MA — April 18
CHICAGO, IL — April 21
DALLAS, TX — May 7
*MINNEAPOLIS, MN — May 14
 
AUSTIN, TX — June 6
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — June 26
BOSTON, MA — September 12
NASHVILLE, TN — October 1
PHILADELPHIA, PA — October 8 
MANHATTAN, NY — October 22
DENVER, CO — October 29
 
 
LOS ANGELES, CA — November 12
 
 
MIAMI, FL — November 26
 
 
SAN FRANCISCO, CA — December 3
FROM DAY ONE 2023 VIRTUAL CONFERENCE SCHEDULE
Jan. 10, 2024 - 
A Fresh Commitment to a Culture of Well-Being
While many employers recognize the connection between well-being and productivity, creating a healthy balance in the real world of work can be challenging. What are the key choices and thoughtful compromises that must be made for workers to thrive as well as produce? How can managers be trained to make the well-being of their workers a top priority? How can companies get a better sense of which benefits and rewards are most effective–and encourage workers to take advantage of them. 
Feb. 14, 2024 - 
Getting to the Next Stage of Diversity and Belonging 
At a time of resistance and corporate austerity, DEI advocates will need to re-energize themselves and their organizations with new ideas, programs, and reasoning for the cause of diversity. What can DEI practitioners learn from companies with consistent success? How are companies changing their policies to respond to court rulings and lawsuits? What practices have brought the most progress in bringing diversity to leadership rank
 
March 6, 2024 - 
Employee Engagement: Tapping the Secrets of Energizing Workers 
Companies want their employees to be enthused and involved, yet employers need to be thoughtful in fostering these qualities in authentic ways. What’s the latest thinking about how employers can understand the motivations of their workers–and how to respond? What are the best methods for recognizing achievement, both individually and among teams? What’s the connection between engagement and job satisfaction? In the hybrid work environment, what binds workers together and wards off anxiety and loneliness?
 
April 3, 2024 - 
Benefits that Fit Individual Needs Without Busting the Budge
Having made a commitment to recognize the unique needs of individuals, the secret is in the execution. What are the emerging benefits and rewards that workers are seeking, from fertility care to financial wellness? How can companies use technology to stay in close touch with what individuals are experiencing–and where they need help as a result? How can companies choose among myriad point solutions and innovative new platforms? What are the most cost-effective rewards in terms of investments and outcomes
May 22, 2024 - 
The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective?
June 12, 2024 - 
Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials?
 
July 10, 2024 - 
Learning and Development: How New Tools Are Changing Upskilling and Career Mobility 
 
 
As employers put more emphasis on skills as the currency for worker development, they’re seeking new ways to measure them, fill in gaps, and predict the skills needed in the future. How can these new tools, including AI, create better matches between employees and projects? How can employers gain insights from the data they gather? Why do real-world simulations help measure certain skills better than traditional assessments? 
 
July 17, 2024 - 
Innovative Benefits That Support Healthy Families and Caregivers
 
 
As the pandemic’s caregiving crisis showed, employers found significant gaps in their support for the parents and other caregivers in their workforces. The resulting scramble to help has produced a wealth of new HR policies, benefit offerings, and management practices. Where is the greatest demand for support, as well as the most innovative new methods? What have been the most cost-effective ways to help caregivers of all kinds, including parents as well as “sandwich generation” workers caring for elderly and disabled relatives? 
 
Aug. 7, 2024 - 
Employee Engagement: Using Technology to Gain Insight Into Work Needs and Ambitions 
 
Traditional methods like town-hall meetings and surveys can be effective, but data and well-drawn insights can give top leaders a heads up about evolving patterns and trends in their workforces. How can AI and other technology be deployed in a way that brings new insights yet still respects privacy and the individual human factors at play? What approaches will bring employers new empathy for worker needs, ambitions, and well-being? 
 
 
 
Aug. 28, 2024 - 
Pursuing Higher Productivity With Human Factors in Mind
 
 
In a competitive and uncertain climate, most companies need to do more with less. Yet if workers are their greatest asset, employers need to make sure the push for greater output is sustainable. What is the latest thinking about how to measure productivity, the means for stimulating it, and ensuring that workers have the energy to meet their goals–as well as thrive over the long run?
Sept. 18, 2024 - 
Building a Corporate Culture That Workers Can Understand, Influence and Embrace  
Company culture is amorphous yet vital–the shared beliefs, values, traditions and behaviors that drive the actions of individuals and the organization as a whole. Who should be the architects of a company’s culture and how should it be designed and constructed? How should the culture be communicated, broadly and in everyday actions? How should a company start out on a project to evolve its culture in a credible way?  
Oct. 16, 2024 - 
Modernizing Your Workplace for a More Flexible, Inclusive Era
 
 
The arrival of hybrid work sent virtually every employer back to the drawing board about what the workplace should look like, including floor plans, digital platforms, meetings, and even office furniture. After more than three years of experimenting, what have innovative companies discovered about what works–and what doesn’t? How have they improved workplace environments to be healthier, as well as more productive? How have these changes affected the goals of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging?
 
 
Nov. 20, 2024 - 
Finding and Deploying HR Tech That Will Empower Workers  
 
 
The blossoming of innovation in HR technology has given employers untold new abilities to organize, inspire, develop, reward, and care for their workers. Yet this revolution presents new challenges for companies in choosing and supervising these tech tools. How should these tech platforms be evaluated? Which departments of the company should take responsibility–and how can organizations coordinate these moves? How can companies make sure they’re empowering their workers rather than overloading them with adaptation and distraction?
 
 
Dec. 11, 2024 - 
Pioneering Approaches to Digital Transformation and the Future of Work
 
 
The emergence of generative AI in 2023 marked the arrival of a transforming technology that will change human roles, add and subtract jobs, and create astounding new capabilities. How can companies manage the transition, both from the short-term competitive pressures to  long-term corporate survival? How can AI be used to unleash creativity? Where are the areas for abuse, intentional or otherwise? How will digital transformation affect fields from talent acquisition to learning and development? 
 
 
 
 
 
Missy Morrison 
From Day One
www.fromdayone.co

Subject:
 DRAFT SurveyMonkey email to Dan 
 
The email with the polls and measurement conversation we come later during the short term plan.
 
Hi Dan,
 
The yearly SurveyMonkey renewal is coming up on September 16
th
. The comparison work to decide whether to keep SurveyMonkey or end our contract with them was assigned to Sarah. With her current circumstance I’m don’t think she’ll have time to get to this. To help with the final decision, a few of us have met and discussed this topic with a plan on the transition. 
 
Recommendation:
 Cancel the SurveyMonkey subscription, but if we don’t want to end it so soon, we can switch over to month to month for the remainder of the year to fully transition. 
 
Below are the three concerns folks expressed with canceling SurveyMonkey:
Past data & reports - Kendall is downloading all data and saving it in Dropbox
Post facilitation surveys - Consultants have piloted these surveys in MS Forms
NPS survey - MS Forms has the same function as SurveyMonkey 
 
Cost:
$900/year - SurveyMonkey
$25/month for 1 seat - SurveyMonkey
Included in Microsoft - MS Forms
 
SurveyMonkey only allows 3 seats, with Kendall owning verification codes and platform management
MS Forms - Everyone has access to MS Forms and there will be no holdup getting codes or access to the platform
 
Short-Term
Keep SurveyMonkey drop down seats, switch over to month-to month 
(3 months max),
 and only use as a back-up
Upskill the staff on how to use MS Forms
Refine current surveys and finalize questions
Make sure the questions collect data that is easily comparable across all client
 
Long-Term
End month-to-month contract with SurveyMonkey 
(2024)
Fully transition over to Microsoft Forms
Standardize all surveys
 
Briza Cardenas  
(she/her)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
LCW

subject: 🎙️ Decoded: New Podcast Release
body:
Join us in unpacking the phrase "You need to watch your tone" with Ralinda Watts from RalindaSpeaks.
 
New Episode Release
Recording & Transcript
 
"You need to watch your tone."
The phrase “you need to watch your tone” is used to silence someone’s voice, invalidating their emotions and perspective in the process. Often bias and cultural difference manifest at the root of this tone policing, especially silencing women and BIPOC employees. So how do we respond when someone says this and how do we begin to create inclusive teams that allow all team members to be heard?
 
To help us unpack this complex topic, 
Brave Conversations with LCW
 Host Larry Baker (he/him) is joined by Ralinda Watts (she/her).
Featuring:
 
Ralinda Watts
DEIJ Expert/Consultant/Educator/Writer
RalindaSpeaks

 | 
Instagram
 | 
Twitter
 |  
Website

subject: Sarah update
body:
Team – As some of you are now aware, Sarah’s husband, Antoino Nodarse, passed away Saturday morning. We are all heartbroken for her loss. Antonio had demonstrated so much courage for months during his treatment. I do not yet have arrangements to share but wanted to ensure that you had her address in case you wanted to send any personal acknowledgements.
 
1255 S Michigan Ave Apt 2806, Chicago, IL, 60605
 
LCW will, of course, send something on behalf of the company but we know that many of you would want to reach out to Sarah individually. We will share any service arrangements as we have them.
 
Thank you all for unselfishly creating a space for Sarah and her family to focus on providing Antonio with comfort during this difficult time. Being able to focus on her family meant everything to Sarah.
 
Best,
 
Chuck
 
Chuck Adams

From:
 Briza Cardenas <b.cardenas@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, September 1, 2023 11:10 AM
To:
 Conner Williams <c.williams@lcwmail.com>; Kendall Washington <k.washington@lcwmail.com>; Emani Richmond <e.richmond@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 DRAFT SurveyMonkey email to Dan 
 
The email with the polls and measurement conversation we come later during the short term plan.
 
Hi Dan,
 
The yearly SurveyMonkey renewal is coming up on September 16
th
. The comparison work to decide whether to keep SurveyMonkey or end our contract with them was assigned to Sarah. With her current circumstance I’m don’t think she’ll have time to get to this. To help with the final decision, a few of us have met and discussed this topic with a plan on the transition. 
 
Recommendation:
 Cancel the SurveyMonkey subscription, but if we don’t want to end it so soon, we can switch over to month to month for the remainder of the year to fully transition. 
 
Below are the three concerns folks expressed with canceling SurveyMonkey:
Past data & reports - Kendall is downloading all data and saving it in Dropbox
Post facilitation surveys - Consultants have piloted these surveys in MS Forms
NPS survey - MS Forms has the same function as SurveyMonkey 
 
Cost:
$900/year - SurveyMonkey
$25/month for 1 seat - SurveyMonkey
Included in Microsoft - MS Forms
 
SurveyMonkey only allows 3 seats, with Kendall owning verification codes and platform management
MS Forms - Everyone has access to MS Forms and there will be no holdup getting codes or access to the platform
 
Short-Term
Keep SurveyMonkey drop down seats, switch over to month-to month 
(3 months max),
 and only use as a back-up
Upskill the staff on how to use MS Forms
Refine current surveys and finalize questions
Make sure the questions collect data that is easily comparable across all client
 
Long-Term
End month-to-month contract with SurveyMonkey 
(2024)
Fully transition over to Microsoft Forms
Standardize all surveys
 
 
Briza Cardenas  
(she/her)
Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO
LCW

subject: [Expensify] Analyze and control spend using Insights and Custom Reporting
body:
After a company adopts Expensify to get all their spend in one place, one of the most common questions we get is: how do I make sense of this? How do I analyze where my money is going, and spend it more efficiently? The answer is simple: click the new 
Insights
 button to get realtime, interactive spend analysis, right in your browser: 
 
Slice and dice your personal, employee, or company spend – across expense reports, corporate cards, invoices, and more – broken down as simple pie charts, or sophisticated time series. Check out 
the Insights help page
 to learn more – or even better: 
let your account manager do it for you
. Click 
Support > Account Manager
 (or ask in your 
#admins
 room), and we'd be happy to help with any of the following: 
Accrual Report
Aged Approval Reports
Attendee Reporting
Audit Report
Candidate Spend
Category Spend Report
Department/Project Spend Report
Duplication Report
Duty of Care
Efficiency
Employee Bank Account Status
Employee Details
Employee Roles
Expense Authorizations by Country
Expense Reports by Country
Expense Reports not posted to finance system
Foreign Currency Transaction
Fringe Benefit Tax Report
HR Report
Invoice Billed Transaction Reconciliation
Mileage Reports
Out of Pocket Expenses for Reimbursement
Per Diem Report
Reconciliation: Accounting, Bank Statement, Billed Transaction
Rejected Report
Travel Rule Class
Travel Spend
Unposted Cash Advance Report
Unposted Procurement Aging Report
Unposted Travel Aging Report
Vendor Spend
… or anything you can imagine.
So get reporting, whether on your own or with our help. It's all included in your base subscription, at no additional cost. Don't just manage expenses, manage spend by transforming realtime data into realtime insights to power your company forward! 
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me on Twitter! 
@dbarrett
 
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103
To unsubscribe, please click 
here

subject: Insight Keynote Recording
body:
Hello Sarah,
 
I hope this message finds you well. We have completed the initial recording, and now our multimedia will be adding the final edits and finishing touches. 
@Kendall Washington
 will be able to send you the file next week for your review, if you think it requires any other edits or changes, please communicate with Kendall. 
 
As I mentioned, I’ll be out of the office from September 4-19; so should you want any more substantial changes or anything else, we can reconnect when I’m back in the office. I really enjoyed delivering the presentation, and believe I was able to highlight the theme, harmony, cultural self-awareness, and belonging. We also included the DIN Model and one of the Dimensions of Difference.
 
Let me know if you have any questions or anything I can resolve for you before I leave the office this week.
 
All the best,
Tamara
 
 
 
Tamara Thorpe
(she/her)
Principal Consultant

subject: Full Calendar - Upcoming Events
body:
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
LIVE EVENT
 
September 12: Boston, Massachusetts
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 13: Using AI to Revolutionize Hiring for Top Talent, While Avoiding the Pitfalls
For talent acquisition, AI presents a remarkable tool that can help by verifying candidates’ backgrounds and skills, suggesting interview questions, creating candidate profiles, and other tasks. As hiring picks up, especially for AI roles, how can TA leaders make the best use of the new technology, while also being on the alert for candidates using AI fraudulently during skills assessments? How can TA specialists use AI to solve many of their pain points, while continuing to focus on the aspects of the job that require the human touch? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 14: What Employers Need to Know About Chronic Kidney Disease: Its Rising Prevalence, Its High Cost, and How to Manage It
Chronic kidney disease (CKD) has become increasingly common, affecting one in seven U.S. adults, yet most people won't know they have it until it has reached an advanced stage. This can present significant challenges for workers, who may have to undergo dialysis or other treatments, and for employers, who may face shockingly high-cost medical claims. This webinar will educate attendees about CKD and provide practical insights to address this condition within an employer's benefits strategy. You'll learn: the facts about CKD and dialysis care in the U.S., the financial implications for employers and workers, and benefits strategies to help address and manage the condition. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 19: Ageism in Industries
Ageism remains the open secret in the advertising, marketing and branding categories. Subtle discrimination is vaguely disguised in commercials and employer branding, especially in the beauty and tech industries. Often times the About Us and Meet our Team landing pages can tell you more about a brand than the nicely polished imagery. If you’re an organization that struggles to attract and retain experienced talent, join AARP Sr Advisor Heather Tinsley-Fix and New & Improved Principal Lisa Balser for a discussion on how ageism shows up in marketing and how employers can signal and implement a more inclusive culture. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 20: Building A Healthy Work Environment to Persevere Through Multiple Challenges
Organizations offering health care and wellness benefits maintain a stronger sense of employee loyalty. Yet health and well-being among employees goes beyond acute or specific physical or mental health needs. How can companies create a culture that emphasizes health through everyday experience? What are the hidden opportunities to nurture this kind of culture? Rather than relying only on standard  benefits to respond in times of unexpected distress, how can organizations address employee needs proactively? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 21: Manager Ratings Are Wrong: It’s Time for a New Era of Fair, Data-Driven Performance Reviews
Personnel is a business’s largest cost, so measuring performance is critical. But research shows that 60% of manager’s ratings are based on their own idiosyncrasies. What can be done to make this critical measuring tool more accurate? Or are we doomed to performance reviews being a necessary evil? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 25: The Future of Employee Engagement and Social Good in Companies
We all know that empowering employees to create social impact–whether it be through volunteering, giving, or general acts of kindness–is good for business. So good, in fact, that a global survey conducted by Nielsen found that 66% of respondents were willing to pay more for products and services from companies committed to positive social and environmental impacts; a Harvard Business Review study found that companies with strong CSR programs experienced up to 50% lower employee-turnover rates compared to companies that did not prioritize CSR. As good as the benefits are, executing a successful social-impact program is becoming increasingly challenging because of rapid changes in the tools available, employee expectations, and restrictions on time. Our question: What is next for employee engagement and social good in companies? Our expert speakers will paint a picture of what the future looks like and what companies and leaders should be doing now to prepare. 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
September 26: Manhattan, New York
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
September 27: Giving Workers Direction About Skills and Career Development
Many workers yearn to grow and advance in their careers, yet don’t have an understanding of how to develop their skills and experience  for a role with more responsibility. Learning and  development can help not only by showing the many possibilities, but also with vision to help employees find the learning and development path that will enable the most fulfilling growth according to their own interests. What can organizations do to deploy coaching in a way that helps not only with short-term goals but also the long arc of a worker’s career? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
September 28: Helping Working Parents Make a Confident Comeback
After parental leave, a working parent’s return to the workforce can be a daunting experience. As they adjust to their new roles as parents and professionals, their self-assurance can lapse and stress can rise. In this interactive webinar, we’ll explore how parents can make a more confident comeback to the workforce. We’ll cover topics such as saying good-bye to the elusive work-life balance and instead embracing “life meets work”; establishing and enforcing healthy boundaries that support well-being and self-efficacy; planning for career progression after parental leave; and how leaders can foster a truly family-friendly work culture. 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 3: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
October 5: Leading Across Generations: How to Build Openness and Trust
Do you manage or work with employees across generations? Are you looking for tools to create and sustain openness and build trust in multigenerational working communities? Whether you are part of the Silent, Baby Boomer, Gen X, Millennial or Gen Z generations, we all need tools to effectively communicate across generations. IBIS Consulting Group will help you address how you can effectively lead across generations through the portrayal of a real-life workplace scenario. IBIS’s team of professional actors will perform a highly engaging and impactful Interactive Theater scene that serves as a starting point for discussion on creating an inclusive culture as we navigate new ways of working across generations. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
October 10: Why Women’s Health Benefits are Essential to Retention, Affordability
Women’s health can be a high cost driver for employers. Additionally, offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But, women’s health in general is not just one condition. Join us for this fireside chat where Ovia Health Chief Medical Officer, Dr. Leslie Saltzman, explains the different facets of women’s health (like menopause, fertility, maternity care management, etc.), what areas generate the most ROI and how employers can offer the deepest, and most all-encompassing benefits to support and delight their employees and medically supported dependents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
October 11: How HR Technology Can Connect, Motivate, and Recognize the Hybrid Workforce
Most workers have strongly embraced hybrid and remote work arrangements, having settled into sustainable routines that allow them to be productive. But camaraderie and a sense of belonging have proven elusive without meaningful face-to-face contact and team-building opportunities. How can organizations create new structures for in-person gatherings that maintain the comfort of remote or hybrid work, as well as new digital approaches that create the ties that bind? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
October 18: Denver, Colorado
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 2: Los Angeles, California
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
November 8: Casting a Wider Net: Fresh, Productive Approaches to Diversity Recruiting
Many companies fall short of their diversity-hiring goals because they keep looking in the same places–and with the same techniques and expectations. What are the best ways for employers to break out of these patterns? How can they reconsider their job specifications to bring in more non-traditional candidates and prospects who could thrive with a modest amount of training and upskilling? What are the new and innovative ways to strengthen a diverse pipeline? 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
November 9: Bridging the Distance: How Tech Can Boost Engagement and Recognition
The broadening scope of rewards is helping employers respond to more diverse needs, as well as giving employers the ability to focus on rewards that provide the biggest impact. What are the newest and most effective rewards, ranging from relocation programs and scholarships to management development and employee recognition? How can companies evaluate these diverse programs in a way that has emotional impact but represent efficient business practices? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
November 14: Miami, Florida
In an environment of constant workplace change, how can employers create a consistent community that builds enduring bonds of trust with workers? Our one-day live conference will bring together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, hybrid work, diversity, benefits, social impact and employee engagement for an up-to-the-minute conversation on topics such as creating equity in a hybrid workplace, balancing productivity with well-being, offering better career paths, developing diversity in leadership, and supporting working parents. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
November 16: From Silence to Support: Revolutionizing Workplace Wellness Through Menopause Benefits
10% of people experiencing menopause have quit their jobs due to their symptoms, yet the majority of companies still don’t offer employees menopause support. Investing in the long-term health of your workforce is better for employees and your company alike—but how do you build benefits that truly make a difference? Join Maven Clinic, the leading women’s and family health company, for an in-depth conversation on menopause in the workplace. You’ll learn how to design menopause benefits that improve your employees’ health and well-being, increasing productivity and lowering attrition. During the event, we’ll explore the connection between menopause support and workplace efficiency and discover actionable ways to build benefits that support your people through this phase of life and beyond. 
Register now
.
WEBINAR
 
December 5: What’s Next: Reinventing Yourself and Your Organization, With Author Joanne Lipman
People are searching for meaningful transformation in their lives and work. For employers, it means they need to know how they can support their workers as they advance in their careers and personal lives. Join Stork Club for a conversation with the renowned journalist and bestselling author Joanne Lipman about her new book, “Next! The Power of Reinvention in Life and Work," to discover what’s behind this trend and how to reinvent your organization, your teams, and yourself. She’ll be joined by Stork Club’s Liz Pittinger, who'll illuminate how Stork Club is helping to innovate family-building and reproductive health benefits. You'll learn why people are ready for change now, the four steps to reinvention, and how to create breakthrough moments. 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
December 13: The Arc of Change for People and Culture in 2024
Recent history affirms that unpredictable events will buffet the workplace of 2024, yet the trajectory of trends in 2023 gives an indication of how organizations will need to be ready for changing expectations among workers and other stakeholders. What are the emerging patterns that leaders should watch in the realms of diversity and inclusion, talent acquisition, employee rewards, learning and development, social responsibility and sustainability? What new points of focus will arrive in the greater field of people and culture? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
January 10: A Fresh Commitment to a Culture of Well-Being
While many employers recognize the connection between well-being and productivity, creating a healthy balance in the real world of work can be challenging. What are the key choices and thoughtful compromises that must be made for workers to thrive as well as produce? How can managers be trained to make the well-being of their workers a top priority? How can companies get a better sense of which benefits and rewards are most effective–and encourage workers to take advantage of them? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
January 24: Atlanta, Georgia
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 6: Houston, Texas
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
February 14: Getting to the Next Stage of Diversity and Belonging
At a time of resistance and corporate austerity, DEI advocates will need to re-energize themselves and their organizations with new ideas, programs, and reasoning for the cause of diversity. What can DEI practitioners learn from companies with consistent success? How are companies changing their policies to respond to court rulings and lawsuits? What practices have brought the most progress in bringing diversity to leadership ranks? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 20: Seattle, Washington
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.
LIVE EVENT
 
February 27: Silicon Valley, California
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
.

subject: RE: CHANGE IN COMPASS & HUBSPOT: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
body:
RP,
 
This has been changed in Compass!
 
Thanks
 
From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 31, 2023 11:09 AM
To:
 Kendall Washington <k.washington@lcwmail.com>; Pedro Seminario <P.seminario@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Andrea Wicks Bowles <a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 CHANGE IN COMPASS & HUBSPOT: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
 
Hi Kendall and Pedro – 
Would you mind 
changing length of the subject workshop from 30-min to 1 hour
 on Compass (Kendall) and HubSpot (Pedro)?
 
The price should not change since we had the cost for ½ hour = the cost for a one hour session.  
 
 
Course description:
In this interactive and engaging session, participants identify and interrupt the biases that can derail our best efforts to be objective and accurate when it comes to performance review and talent calibration. Participants practice recognizing and responding to bias and learn strategies and tips to mitigate our bias during performance evaluations. The session is designed for individuals ready to disrupt their own biases when evaluating talent and giving feedback.
Objectives:
Identify biases that can derail objective and accurate performance reviews
Practice recognizing and responding to bias 
Learn strategies and tips to mitigate bias during performance evaluations
1 facilitator
 
 
 
Dan
:
 would you mind letting the entire CT know? Thanks.
 
 
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW
 
From:
 Daniel Gough <
d.gough@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 31, 2023 10:47 AM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: RESPONSE: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
 
Sounds good to me. thanks
 
 
 
Daniel Gough, PhD
(he/him)
Principal Consultant
LCW

From:
 Rebecca Parrilla <
r.parrilla@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 31, 2023 8:32 AM
To:
 Daniel Gough <
d.gough@lcwmail.com
>; Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>; Andrea Wicks Bowles <
a.wicksbowles@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RESPONSE: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
 
Hi, y’all.  
 
I worked on a proposal for a 
prospect who was interested in a session re: managing bias in performance reviews
. 
I knew we’d built a 30-min session for Carta on this topic (they’re unique in wanting these very short sessions) but as I reviewed the slides, I realized it’s a lot of content for 30 minutes, and could be 
extended to an hour largely by allowing more discussion time
. 
I also think offering a half hour course is a bit odd in the context of the rest of our workshops, 
one hour seems more appropriate
. 
So I ended up quoting the one hour price for this session, thinking
 that if we get it, we’d put in the relatively light work of expanding it to an hour
. 
What do you think?
 
I would 
recommend selling this workshop as a hour going forward
, as it more closely aligns with our miniworkshops, for example. 
We’d have to change the pricing, as well as the description, from 30 min to 1 hour, in both Compass and HubSpot.
 
This is the workshop I’m talking about:
 
 
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW

|

|

|

 |

subject: CHANGE IN COMPASS & HUBSPOT: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
body:
Hi Kendall and Pedro – 
Would you mind 
changing length of the subject workshop from 30-min to 1 hour
 on Compass (Kendall) and HubSpot (Pedro)?
 
The price should not change since we had the cost for ½ hour = the cost for a one hour session.  
 
 
Course description:
In this interactive and engaging session, participants identify and interrupt the biases that can derail our best efforts to be objective and accurate when it comes to performance review and talent calibration. Participants practice recognizing and responding to bias and learn strategies and tips to mitigate our bias during performance evaluations. The session is designed for individuals ready to disrupt their own biases when evaluating talent and giving feedback.
Objectives:
Identify biases that can derail objective and accurate performance reviews
Practice recognizing and responding to bias 
Learn strategies and tips to mitigate bias during performance evaluations
1 facilitator
 
 
 
Dan
:
 would you mind letting the entire CT know? Thanks.
 
 
 
 
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
(she/her)
Head of Business Development
LCW
 
From:
 Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 31, 2023 10:47 AM
To:
 Rebecca Parrilla <r.parrilla@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: RESPONSE: How to Disrupt Your Bias When Evaluating Talent
 
Sounds good to me. thanks
 
 
 
Daniel Gough, PhD
(he/him)
Principal Consultant
LCW

From:
